channel.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
channel.description: How many hours do you guys usually spend on a track from start to finish?

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: Sunny
item.description:
It might take me a day or two to get the bare bones of a track.

My problem/advantage is that I’m a strong self editor. I’ll edit and add and cut for weeks — mainly because I may only have only 15 mins here and there every day.

I also don’t concentrate on a task for more than two hours becuase I like to move around. But the song probably takes about as long as someone working on it in a day (maybe a 10 hours all together).

Read full topic
item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

tracks take me like… about a half hour usually. 20-30 mins, maybe 35-40. oh, and the occasional at least one day.

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: INDIR3CT
item.description:
On weekdays 2 Hours
On weekends 3 Hours

I’ve been trying to work on one Track each week. Then If I go into settings and see the battery usage of apps, it will tell me how much I use auxy within the past 7 days. So my current song I’m working on has about 9 hours on it. (Its sucks tho)

item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: OIL
item.description:
Add a new instrument, or melody, or drum track. Even if it seems like a non-sequitur, it’s something that could poke your brain into thinking of new stuff. Hell, even adding an automation clip from another song you made to an instrument could change your entire perception of the song.

There was one track I made where I wasn’t sure how to continue, so I did the automation clip thing on that and ended up with something that I thought was really cool.

Hope that helped, yo.

Read full topic
item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: DHO
item.description:
I feel like my songs could improve if I spent more time on them, but whenever I try to keep working on a song after an hour or so (after I consider it “finished” I can’t.) Anybody have any advice?

Read full topic

item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: OIL
item.description:
Honestly, I’ve made stuff in an hour. It’s just really nice to make tracks, I guess. I don’t really want to get popular. I just love music. I mean, if I were to get paid for it, that’d be cool. There are tracks that take ages to produce, though. I guess it just depends on how into it I am.

Like the adage goes, “Art is like farting: When you can, you can; when you can’t, you can’t. And if you force it… It comes out as s*it.”

Read full topic
item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

It doesn’t much matter. Work on it until it’s done

item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

item.title: How long does it take you to make a full track?
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
My recent tracks I’ve spent 30+ hours on. That’s pretty bad compared to you guys with your amazing 10 hour songs. Mine aren’t even that great.

I guess the recent lack of motivation comes into play, and I’ll spend a month going back and adding touches until it’s done. These days I’ve only been opening Auxy when I’m bored. I hope soon I’ll get back in the groove, and can start pumping out tracks like I used to.

edit: by 30 hours I mean 30 hours total spent having the project open and doing stuff to it. And it’s probably more like 40+ now that I think of it. Idk

tl;dr: 30-40+ hours for me to make a track, mainly because I’m bored and unmotivated, and blah blah

Read full topic
item.source: How long does it take you to make a full track?

item.description:

…I have way too many as-of-yet unreleased demos.
